compounds.local_name: メタナミド（ホルムアミド）
compounds.series_general_formula: Primary amides from monocarboxylic acids: RCONH2 (n>=0, n=0 gives formamide)
compounds.notes: Simplest carboxylic acid amide; highly polar; used as solvent and intermediate; typical example when introducing the amide functional group.

compounds.local_name: エタナミド（アセトアミド）
compounds.series_general_formula: Primary amides from saturated monocarboxylic acids: CnH2n+1CONH2
compounds.notes: Most commonly discussed aliphatic amide; derived from ethanoic acid; used as example of high melting point and hydrogen bonding in amides.

compounds.series_general_formula: Primary amides from saturated monocarboxylic acids: CnH2n+1CONH2
compounds.notes: Higher member of the aliphatic amide series; useful for homologous-series questions and for comparing physical properties with ethanamide.

compounds.series_general_formula: Diamides (carbamides): general structure H2N-CO-NH2 or substituted analogs
compounds.notes: Most important biological amide; end product of protein metabolism in mammals; typical example of a diamide in high-school chemistry.
